text:
Kaleb designs another spinner that he thinks will most likely give him a 11:00 pm bedtime on any one spin.

To convince his grandparent to use this spinner, he puts three 9:00 spaces, two 10:00 spaces, and one 11:00 space on the spinner.
• Make a prediction: Which time do you think is most likely to occur? Is Kaleb’s grandparent likely to agree to use this spinner? Explain why or why not.

Students should choose either 9:00 or 11:00. The total angle at the center is 135° for 11:00, and 9:00 has three angles each measuring 45° for a total of 135°. For 10:00 the angles measure 45˚ each for a total of 90°. So, it is more likely the spinner will land on 9:00 or 11:00 since these are equally likely and more likely than 10:00.

Answers will vary. Kaleb’s grandparent is not likely to choose this spinner, because the likelihood of a bedtime of 11:00 is the same as that of 9:00. And, going to bed at 9 pm is the less likely than going to bed later.

However, this spinner is better than Spinner 1, 2, or 3, because those spinners have a 1 in 2 chance (or 180° out of 360°) of going to bed at 9 pm. The spinner in the Initial Challenge is less likely to have Kaleb going to bed at 9 pm.
• What is the theoretical probability that the pointer lands on 9:00, on 10:00, and on 11:00? Explain.

P(9:00 pm) = 3/8 or 37.5%

P(10:00 pm) = 2/8= 1/4 or 25%

P(11:00 pm) = 3/8 or 37.5%

These are the sums of the angle measures marked for 9:00, 10:00, and 11:00.
• Suppose Kaleb spins the pointer 64 times. Based on your theoretical probabilities, how many times can he expect the pointer to land on 9:00, on 10:00, and on 11:00?
24 times for 9:00, 16 times for 10:00, and 24 times for 11:00
• Describe one way Kaleb’s grandparent can design a spinner so that Kaleb is most likely to go to bed at 9:00 pm.

Kaleb’s grandparent needs to make a spinner such that the sum of the angles of the 9:00 sections is greater than 180°.

Alternatively, this question can be interpreted to mean that Kaleb would be more likely to go to bed at 9:00 than at any other single time, in which case the sum of the angles of the 9:00 sections needs to be greater than the sums of the angles of the sections for 10:00 and 11:00.
